subject.normal: [osol-discuss] What is the proper forum to discuss alternate filesystems?

headers.subject: [osol-discuss] What is the proper forum to discuss alternate filesystems?
headers.x-spam-status: No, score=-1.8 required=5.0 tests=BAYES_00,INVALID_DATE, MISSING_HEADERS,NO_RECEIVED,NO_RELAYS autolearn=disabled version=3.2.4

quote.quotepara:
In particular I am wondering if there is any work done or planned to start
supporting additional file systems. Foe example: - jffs2/squashfs

body.para: I have one student who just started to work on JFFS2 support. Based on docu, just from scratch, it will take some time.
Another is working on ext2 native driver, which could be extended to ext3 in the future.
And as others wrote, FUSE can be bridge for some other filesystems.
